body:
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/0602b06c8dbc292e3dc5a79c84f7d44e068d65c4/framework/db/BaseActiveRecord.php#L445-L454

The problem will go away if we will clone `$this` pointer. I.e. `$query->primaryModel = clone $this;`
Are there any flaws of the solution except `ActiveRecordTes::testInverseOf()` test failing?
That would be different object eating extra memory and not reacting to changes.

Same problem here.

There's an error with last fix for #16552 (Commit here: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/5ee7fabbf948f3a759f5cfd9f76c72eef17694c8)

Both relations use the same _via('articleToFiles')_ so the first call to getMainImage() will populate Foo's property articleToFiles AND add a filter with $callable; the next call to getLogoImage() will find property articleToFiles already populated (framework/db/ActiveQuery.php:182 `if ($this->primaryModel->isRelationPopulated($viaName))`) and will not reset its values appending new data from second query returning just first result because we use hasOne() (so the same record).

We can fix the code using viaTable() that isn't cached like via() relations or we need a way to avoid the isRelationPopulated() check on via() relations with $callable filter

What do you think about ?
